update.description:
Thanks to the great improvements on playback speed done on pull request #1931, it's now feasible to jump to a specific moment in time on the log.

* Now the current time is editable

![log_edit_time.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2204722306-log_edit_time.png)

* Time is skipped to the closest available sample, just like dragging the line.

* If the user input doesn't respect the format, we stay at the current time

* It's not possible to load logs on QTests yet, so there's no test for `LogPlayWidget`.
update.title: Enter time during log playback

content.raw: looks good to me
content.html: looks good to me

content.raw: Sounds good to me +1
content.html: Sounds good to me +1

content.raw: ah got it! Maybe we can revisit this later if users start getting confused.
content.html: ah got it! Maybe we can revisit this later if users start getting confused.

content.raw: I'm just talking about the position of the label that shows the `total log time`. I think it looks nicer if it's on the same line than the `current log time` label.
content.html: I'm just talking about the position of the label that shows the total log time. I think it looks nicer if it's on the same line than the current log time label.

content.raw: humm I'm not sure I understood what you mean, but it sounds like undesired behaviour. Can you elaborate a bit?
content.html: humm I'm not sure I understood what you mean, but it sounds like undesired behaviour. Can you elaborate a bit?

content.raw: @iche033 , the PR has changed a bit since you reviewed it. Please let me know if you still approve and I'll merge it. Thanks!
content.html: @iche033 , the PR has changed a bit since you reviewed it. Please let me know if you still approve and I'll merge it. Thanks!

content.raw: Thanks, everything works as expected now. The only thing that I don't like 100% is that the total log time stays below the current log time. It maybe me that I'm picky but I think it would look nicer if we can keep it next to the current log time. In any case I'm approving because I consider it an optional enhancement.
content.html: Thanks, everything works as expected now. The only thing that I don't like 100% is that the total log time stays below the current log time. It maybe me that I'm picky but I think it would look nicer if we can keep it next to the current log time. In any case I'm approving because I consider it an optional enhancement.

content.raw: Ok, sounds good
content.html: Ok, sounds good

content.raw: Yes, but the timeline doesn't "shrink", a horizontal scroll bar appears. But only if the window is not big enough to accommodate everything.
content.html: Yes, but the timeline doesn't "shrink", a horizontal scroll bar appears. But only if the window is not big enough to accommodate everything.

content.raw: Nice, thanks for wrestling with this for so long. If the log is days long, do the fields just cause the timeline to shrink a bit to the left?
content.html: Nice, thanks for wrestling with this for so long. If the log is days long, do the fields just cause the timeline to shrink a bit to the left?

content.raw:
As per our discussion, I changed the input to separate fields. @spaepcke @caguero

![edit_log_2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2770243643-edit_log_2.png)
content.html: As per our discussion, I changed the input to separate fields. @spaepcke @caguero

content.raw: Leaving the time field dark grey sounds good to me. When the user clicks the time or the dark grey area, the cursor appears there. That possible?
content.html: Leaving the time field dark grey sounds good to me. When the user clicks the time or the dark grey area, the cursor appears there. That possible?

content.raw: Thanks. I'll fix these and add tests. Keep them coming :smile:

content.raw: If you are in 10.793 and you edit the time and set it to 10.79301, the line jumps to the end of the log file.
content.html: If you are in 10.793 and you edit the time and set it to 10.79301, the line jumps to the end of the log file.

content.raw: I was poking around with random keystrokes...If you add a negative value to the second or millisecond part, the line jumps to the end of the log file.
content.html: I was poking around with random keystrokes...If you add a negative value to the second or millisecond part, the line jumps to the end of the log file.

content.raw:
I thought it was supposed to be like this in the spec but I can't find it anymore. I might have just made it up. Just to confirm, @spaepcke , was there a reason to have the field looking "flat" while not selected but dark grey when being edited?

![log_edit.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/807449667-log_edit.png)
content.html: I thought it was supposed to be like this in the spec but I can't find it anymore. I might have just made it up. Just to confirm, @spaepcke , was there a reason to have the field looking "flat" while not selected but dark grey when being edited?

content.raw:
Just a UX comment. It's not obvious that the time is editable. When you click on the time label to edit the time, it becomes clear but not before.

Can we keep that field with the dark grey color background maybe?
content.html:
Just a UX comment. It's not obvious that the time is editable. When you click on the time label to edit the time, it becomes clear but not before.

Can we keep that field with the dark grey color background maybe?

content.raw: Yeah Nate had mentioned chrono when I implemented `Time::FormattedString` on pull request #1710. I guess we should take a look at it some day :sweat_smile:

content.raw:
by the way, there are some functions for parsing time strings, 
e.g. [example on stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21021388/how-to-parse-a-date-string-into-a-c11-stdchrono-time-point-or-similar)

Just for reference only. What you have here should work too.
